Direct Translation: When we are in the tavern,
Poetic Translation: When we're in the tavern drinking,

Direct Translation: we don・・t care about dust,
Poetic Translation: Mighty thoughts no one is thinking.

Direct Translation: but we quickly start gaming,
Poetic Translation: We run over to the table,

Direct Translation: which always makes us sweat.
Poetic Translation: Betting, sweating, and unstable.

Direct Translation: ・・What happens in the tavern,
Poetic Translation: If you ask me, then you can learn

Direct Translation: where money is the host?
Poetic Translation: Just what happens in the tavern,

Direct Translation: How does that work?・・ you may well ask,
Poetic Translation: Money hosting, people paying:

Direct Translation: but listen to what I say.
Poetic Translation: Listen to what I am saying.

Direct Translation: Some gamble, some drink,
Poetic Translation: Some folks gamble, some are aimless,

Direct Translation: Some live immorally.
Poetic Translation: Some are slutty, loud, and shameless.

Direct Translation: But of those who gamble,
Poetic Translation: Those who lose the coin they gamble

Direct Translation: some are stripped bare;
Poetic Translation: Exit nakedly to ramble.

Direct Translation: some wear their clothes,
Poetic Translation: Those who win a few more rounds will

Direct Translation: and some wear sacks.
Poetic Translation: End up wearing sacks and towels.

Direct Translation: Here there is no fear of death,
Poetic Translation: Death forgotten, nothing shocks us,

Direct Translation: but in the name ofﾂBacchusﾂthey throw the dice.
Poetic Translation: Dicing in the name of Bacchus.

Direct Translation: First of all dice and wine,
Poetic Translation: First we take the dice and cast them,

Direct Translation: as the libertines drink.
Poetic Translation: Drunks with wine enough to last them;

Direct Translation: Drink next for those in prison,
Poetic Translation: Then drink twice for those in prison;

Lyrics: post hec bibunt ter pro vivis,
Direct Translation: after that, three times for the living,
Poetic Translation: Drink three times for all the living;

Direct Translation: four times for all Christians,
Poetic Translation: Four to Christian souls purehearted;

Direct Translation: five times for the faithful departed,
Poetic Translation: Five times to the long-departed;

Direct Translation: six times for loose sisters,
Poetic Translation: Six to nuns with loosened habits;

Direct Translation: seven times for the soldiers of the forest.
Poetic Translation: Seven times to forest bandits.

Direct Translation: Eight for the perverse brethren,
Poetic Translation: Eight times drink to priestly lechers;

Direct Translation: nine times for scattered monks,
Poetic Translation: Nine to monks who drift at leisure;

Direct Translation: ten times for the seamen,
Poetic Translation: Ten to those who sail the ocean;

Direct Translation: eleven times for the quarrelers,
Poetic Translation: Eleven to those who cause commotions;

Direct Translation: twelve times for the penitent,
Poetic Translation: Twelve to those who do their penance;

Direct Translation: thirteen times for those on journeys.
Poetic Translation: Thirteen to rovers and dependants.

Lyrics: Tam pro papa quam pro rege
Direct Translation: For both the pope and the king
Poetic Translation: Pope and King in acclamation

Direct Translation: they all drink without restraint.
Poetic Translation: Toast with all immoderation.

Direct Translation: The mistress drinks, the master drinks,
Poetic Translation: Drinks the mistress, drinks the master,

Direct Translation: the soldier drinks, the cleric drinks,
Poetic Translation: Drinks the guard, the cleric faster,

Direct Translation: he drinks, she drinks,
Poetic Translation: Drinks he, drinks she, free and fervent,

Direct Translation: the servant drinks with the maid,
Poetic Translation: Drinks the maid beside the servant,

Direct Translation: the quick one drinks, the lazy one drinks,
Poetic Translation: Drinks the worker, drinks the sluggard,

Direct Translation: the white one drinks, the black one drinks,
Poetic Translation: Drinks white, black, and every color,

Direct Translation: the constant one drinks, the unpredictable one drinks,
Poetic Translation: Drinks the constant, drinks the fickle,

Direct Translation: the hick drinks, the educated one drinks,
Poetic Translation: Drinks the learned and the simple.

Direct Translation: The poor drinks and the sick,
Poetic Translation: Drinks the poor, the sick in danger,

Direct Translation: the exile drinks and the stranger,
Poetic Translation: Drinks the exile, drinks the stranger,

Direct Translation: the boy drinks, the old man drinks,
Poetic Translation: Drinks the child and drinks the elder,

Direct Translation: the prelate drinks and the deacon,
Poetic Translation: Drinks the prelate and his helper,

Direct Translation: the sister drinks, the brother drinks,
Poetic Translation: Drinks the sister, drinks the brother,

Direct Translation: the old woman drinks, the mother drinks,
Poetic Translation: Drinks the grandma, drinks the mother,

Direct Translation: this one drinks, that one drinks,
Poetic Translation: Drinks this one and that, carousing,

Direct Translation: a hundred drink, a thousand drink.
Poetic Translation: Drink by hundreds, drink by thousands.

Direct Translation: Six pennies don・・t last very long
Poetic Translation: All our coin in dissipation

Direct Translation: where without moderation
Poetic Translation: Spent where with immoderation

Direct Translation: all drink without measure,
Poetic Translation: All are drinking without measure,

Direct Translation: but drinking makes the mind merry.
Poetic Translation: But our drinking brings us pleasure.

Direct Translation: So everyone scolds us,
Poetic Translation: Everybody scolds us bluntly,

Direct Translation: and we are poor.
Poetic Translation: And we're always short of money.

Direct Translation: He who scolds us, let him be shamed,
Poetic Translation: Sober critics who won't buy in:

Direct Translation: and let him not be recorded among the just.
Poetic Translation: They can suck it. No one likes them!

Direct Translation: Carol Anne Perry Lagemann
Poetic Translation: Carol Anne Perry Lagemann
